org.framed.orm.ui.action

Class StepAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • SelectionAction
      • org.framed.orm.ui.action.StepAction
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StepInAction, StepInNewPageAction, StepInNewTabAction, StepOutAction

    public class StepAction
extends SelectionAction
    This action is the super action for the different stepactions, which all have almost the same code for the method calculateEnabled() and the method run(). But all these actions need their own class, because the id and the text which is set in the constructor is by all actions different.
    Author:
    Kay Bierzynski

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String STEP_ID
      String which contains the id of this action.
      static String STEP_REQUEST
      String which contains the type of the request, which is connected to this action.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StepAction(org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart part)
      Constructor of this action, where the id of the action and the text, which is shown for example in the context menu, is set and the special request connected to this action is created .

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected boolean calculateEnabled()
      The action is enabled if the selected entity on the editor is a ORMShapeEditPart instance , where the Shape is from type compartmenttype or group, and the method testEnabled() returns true.
      void run()
      Execute the command that performs the StepIn or the StepOut.
      void setRequest(Request request)
      A setter for the request.
      boolean testEnabled(String id)
      A method where in case of step out it is tested if the selected editpart equals the editpart, which is strechted out over the background of the view and in case of step in it is tested if the selected editpart unequals the editpart, which is strechted out over the background of the view.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        String which contains the id of this action.

        public static final String STEP_REQUEST
        String which contains the type of the request, which is connected to this action.
        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • StepAction

        public StepAction(org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart part)
        Constructor of this action, where the id of the action and the text, which is shown for example in the context menu, is set and the special request connected to this action is created .
        Parameters:
        part - org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Execute the command that performs the StepIn or the StepOut. It is assumed that this method is executed directly after calculateEnabled()

      • calculateEnabled

        protected boolean calculateEnabled()

        The action is enabled if the selected entity on the editor is a ORMShapeEditPart instance , where the Shape is from type compartmenttype or group, and the method testEnabled() returns true.

      • testEnabled

        public boolean testEnabled(String id)
        A method where in case of step out it is tested if the selected editpart equals the editpart, which is strechted out over the background of the view and in case of step in it is tested if the selected editpart unequals the editpart, which is strechted out over the background of the view.
        Parameters:
        id - java.lang.String
        Returns:
        true in case of step out if the selected editpart equals the editpart, which is strechted out over the background of the view or in case of step in if the selected editpart unequals the editpart, which is strechted out over the background of the view

      • setRequest

        public void setRequest(Request request)
        A setter for the request. This method exits so that the child classes can overide the request of this class with their own special type request.
        Parameters:
        request - org.eclipse.gef.Request
